articles.title: First Total Lunar Eclipse to Be Seen
articles.content:
First Total Lunar Eclipse to Be Seen
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The first total lunar eclipse is to be seen in Pyongyang this year.
					 According to Kang Chang Hyok, a researcher of the Pyongyang Observatory under the State Academy of Sciences, the total lunar eclipse is expected on January 31.
					
					 The eclipse of the moon will start from 20:18 and end at 23:41. And the total lunar eclipse will be at 22:00 and the phase of eclipse 1.3.
					
					 The total lunar eclipse was observed in 2014 and 2015.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Marking 70th Birthday of DPRK as Festival of Victors
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Marking 70th Birthday of DPRK as Festival of Victors
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Monday in an editorial appeals to all the people to more fully demonstrate the heroic spirit of Juche Korea, firmly united in one thought and purpose around the great Workers' Party of Korea, this year when they will celebrate the 70th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Great leap forward and innovation should be made in the present general offensive to greet the 70th birthday of the DPRK with splendor in the spirit of the great unity, the editorial says, adding:
					
					 By steadily inheriting the precious tradition of the great Chollima upswing that was created in the difficult postwar period to devotedly defend the idea and authority of President Kim Il Sung with trust in him only, we have to go all out for the campaign to carry through the tasks set forth in the New Year Address of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 We should perform praiseworthy feats through the general offensive this year in the same spirit and traits as displayed by the defense scientists who made devoted efforts last year to demonstrate to the world that the Party's plan and decision is a science and truth and that they automatically mean their materialization.
					
					 We must complete the construction of the Wonsan-Kalma coastal tourist area in the shortest period of time on the strength of the army-people great unity and accelerate the major construction projects.
					
					 Under the slogan "One for all and all for one!" all the sectors and units should help each other and launch a socialist emulation and make joint innovations.
					
					 It is the firm will of the Party to bring about a new upswing in the revolution and bring earlier the final victory of socialism by further strengthening the might of the single-minded unity.

articles.title: "America First" Drives U.S. into Isolation and Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
"America First" Drives U.S. into Isolation and Ruin: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- "America first" is the chauvinist doctrine which is driving the U.S. into isolation and ruin as it persists in inequality and racial discrimination in the international relations and the war-first doctrine wrecking global peace, prompted by its hegemonic nature, Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article.
					 It is also extreme state egoism driving the U.S. into isolation politically and economically, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The burglarious logic for aggression "America first" justifying the act of depriving other countries and nations of sovereignty and rights to existence and development serves as strong catalyst accelerating ruin of the empire of evils in every part of the world.
					
					 "America first" calling for sacrificing the world for its own abundant life drives even the allies and henchmen of the U.S. into a dilemma and creates a chaos in the overall West economy.
					
					 "America first" is being buffeted by criticism of the international community as it is a doctrine to turn the world into a theatre of rampage by the jungle law through highhanded and arbitrary practices.
					
					 It is natural in the light of the law of causality that the empire of evils wielding "America first" stick for aggression and plunder in the world is hit by the international community.
					
					 "America first", Yankee-style hegemonic doctrine saying that everything should exist for the U.S., accelerates isolation and ruin of the empire of evils in all aspects of politics, economy, military affairs and diplomacy.

articles.title: S. Korean Conservatives' Anti-Reunification Campaign under Fire
articles.content:
S. Korean Conservatives' Anti-Reunification Campaign under Fire
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The conservative group of south Korea are behaving mischievously, finding fault with every matter the north and the south are pushing ahead over the Winter Olympics.
					 Commenting on the fact, Rodong Sinmun Monday says it is the last-ditch effort to spoil the hard-won climate for improved north-south relations and block our participation in the Winter Olympics.
					
					 It goes on: 
					
					 Clear is the reason why the south Korean conservatives are making a desperate bid with blood-shot eyes. Having prolonged remaining days with dependence on outsiders and confrontation with the compatriots, they consider the improvement of the north-south relations as a horrible nightmare of tightening their windpipes.
					
					 The tragedy of national division has been going on for over seven decades and a grave situation fraught with the danger of war has persisted on this land owing to the flunkeyist and treacherous confrontation moves of the south Korean conservative group being parasitic on the U.S.
					
					 However, they are getting ever more desperate in their moves of confrontation with the compatriots although they were ousted from power, far from reflecting on their unpardonable crimes against reunification. 
					
					 All these facts clearly show once again that the south Korean conservatives are a cancer-like being in the way for improvement of the north-south relations, peace and national reunification and a group of top-class traitors that should be no longer allowed to go at large.
					
					 No matter how desperately they may try to mislead the public opinion, nobody will lend an ear to their trumpeting.
					
					 The south Korean conservatives would be well advised to stop at once such foolish smear campaign making their end more miserable and prepare themselves to stand their trial for the thrice-cursed crimes they committed against the nation.

articles.title: S. Korean Workers Protest against Unreasonable Labor Policy
articles.content:
S. Korean Workers Protest against Unreasonable Labor Policy
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- School part-time workers of south Korea reportedly took a demo on Jan. 26 to protest against the authorities for massively dismissing part-time workers under the pretence of turning part-time jobs into full-time ones.
					 In this regard, they called a press conference outside the "government" building in Seoul.
					
					 They declared that they would struggle until a proper policy is made.
					
					 Then they marched to the Chongwadae.

articles.title: S. Korea: Conservative Media Blasted for Inciting Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korea: Conservative Media Blasted for Inciting Confrontation
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The Seoul City Committee of the People's Party of south Korea held a news conference before the Media Arbitration Committee on Jan. 24 to denounce the conservative media for seeking to prevent the inter-Korean ties from improving, according to the south Korean online paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Speakers condemned Chosun Ilbo for distorting and exaggerating the realities of the north to throw a serious roadblock in the way of improving the south-north relations with the north's participation in the Winter Olympics as an occasion.
					
					 The Seoul City Committee of the party presented a written opinion to the Media Arbitration Committee.

articles.title: Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced in Nigeria
articles.content:
Brief Biography of Kim Jong Il Introduced in Nigeria
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website the brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il on Jan. 11 in the run-up to the 76th anniversary of his birth.

articles.title: Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Nepal
articles.content:
Day of Sun, Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Nepal
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- A Nepalese national preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Kathmandu on Jan. 16.
					 C. P. Mainali, general secretary of the C.C., Nepal Communist Party (Marxist-Leninist) and former deputy prime minister of Nepal, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to give wide publicity to the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il through media and organize colorful political and cultural events on these anniversaries.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Iceland
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Iceland
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Reykjavik, Iceland on Jan. 17.
					 Jon Arni Halldorsson, general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to organize political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Norway
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Marked in Norway
 Pyongyang, January 29 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for celebrating the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il (the Day of the Shining Star) was formed in Norway on January 17.
					 Dag Norum, chairman of the Ostfold County Committee of the Communist Party of Norway, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The preparatory committee decided to hold colorful political and cultural events praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star.

articles.title: Se observara en Pyongyang primer eclipse lunar total del ano
articles.content:
Se observara en Pyongyang primer eclipse lunar total del ano
Pyongyang, 29 de enero (ACNC) -- De acuerdo con Kang Chang Hyok, investigador del Observatorio Astronomico de Pyongyang de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, se preve que se observara el dia 31 en Pyongyang el primer eclipse lunar total de este ano.
					El fenomeno natural comenzara a las 20:18 y terminara a las 23:41 y tendra el maximo eclipse a las 22:00 y el digito 1.3.
					
					El eclipse lunar total en los anos recientes se ha visto en 2014 y 2015.
